name: Dreams Los Cabos Suites Golf Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dreams was terrific. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great food and rooms. Very safe.
reviews.title: Overall great experience
Nice location but sales pitch and "resort credit" not appreciated
reviews.text: I was there for a friends wedding and the entire trip was outstanding. The pool was one of the best parts of the entire trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The most difficult part was getting to and from the city.
reviews.title: Dreams turned into Nightmares

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Dreams Los Cabos in late September 2012. The property is beautiful, the room was very nice, clean, roomy, and very comfortable. Room service was quick. Having breakfast on our room's patio overlooking the pool and the ocean was fantastic. We enjoyed leaving the sliding glass patio door open a bit at night to hear the waves crashing all night. The service was great too. The drinks were weak, unless you specifically asked for a strong one. The little nightclub was pretty lame. Each evening they leave in your room a list of the following day's activities. I was looking forward to a tennis clinic one morning, and I showed up right on time. Unfortunately no one from the resort showed up. After a while I met another guest and we played tennis (rackets and balls available at front desk) but it was a little disappointing that nobody from the resort ever showed up. The same thing happened one morning for their organized beach walk. No one from the resort showed up. Maybe it was because there were not a lot of guests while we were there. But if that's the case, the resort should not publish that they're going to have these activities. Also- their website shows "beach party" as one of the activities. In 4 nights, there was no beach party. They did have a nice Mexican variety show one night, and an interesting dance show another night, and outdoor movies each night on a large inflatable screen near the pool.
reviews.title: Rena C. Calgary, Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had read reviews before I went and was worried. I had never been to Mexico before but I decided to go without any expectations and had the best time! I went with 3 other family members (adult women) and had a wonderful time. Never once did I feel unsafe. The hotel room was clean and always stocked. The movie on the beach was fun and the shows every night were great. We called room service at 2:00am and it came quickly and the food was good. The bars and the pools were wonderful. Food was good and service was excellent.
reviews.title: One Of ZThe Best Trips Ever
Simply the best
reviews.text: Went on the Pub Crawl which was a great and safe way to see the clubs. Absolutly worth the $20.

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: Loved every bit of it and will go back again!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel all over the world. This trip was our extended family vacation. We booked three rooms for the five of us.
reviews.title: Wonderful honeymoon

likes.liked: — All inclusive!! not stress at meal time!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my Parents and Aunt's first All Inculsive. My Parents were very leary of doing an All Inclusive. My hubby and I stay at All Inclusives all the time and love them. This is by far the BEST All Inclusive we have stayed at.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Casa Club Dorado Spa and Beach Resort @ Dreams

likes.liked: — Our beautiful one bedroom apartment on the third floor, on the corner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Awful musky "suites", terrible service at the front desk, they are rude, uneducated and lack of problem solving skills, blaming the travel agency instead of offering a solution. I specifically requested 2 connected master suites (with one king and 2 queen size beds). In exchange, I got 2 rooms with 2 king sized beds. With 4 kids it is impossible to have them sleep under those conditions. Rooms are dark, they smell awful. Decoration is generic and cheap.
reviews.title: Awful, cheap attention, terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They offered a "down-grade" with no refunds to get a smaller room with 2 beds for the kids. I also mentioned we were arriving at noon, and the agency guaranteed rooms were going to get priority to avoid waiting to check-in at 3pm. Needless to say, we had to wait for 3 hours, rooms were not ready.
reviews.title: Dreams come true at Dream Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never again. Stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Best Hotel by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a great 5 day vacation in a great 5 star Resort. You will never find so many professional and helpful staff. The Dreams is fantastic. Very romantic and the views were breath taking. There is always something to do you will never get bored. on Wednesdays and Saturdays they will take you to 4 clubs in the city with chaperons, so is safe and you should not miss it.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an A+ Hotel . We stayed in a corner room, ocean front . It was an amazing room !!! The service is great and the food is good. I loved the infinity pool . The beach was my favorite but it's only for good swimmers . We've been to Cabo a few times and this is by far the best Hotel in cabo. It was like 30 minutes from cabo san lucas and like 20 from san jose del cabo.
reviews.title: Anniversary Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from 5 horrible days at Dreams resort in Los cabos and I felt compelled to share my experience to perhaps save other potential travelers from having their vacation ruined the way our's was. First off, I should have known better but I booked the trip through the Airline which is the worst way to do things. When you book that way, you are completely locked into that trip with no recourse and no way to check out and go somewhere else. Since I booked the trip that way, I was not able to check out the next day which I would have. The hotel put us in the worst room in the hotel. Yes we were facing the ocean which I paid for.( the trip cost me including air, 1000/day. )The room was located right over the main restraunt which played very loud music from 7am till 10pm. The music reverberated through the room and it was impossible to tune it out. there were 5 rooms on our floor and we were the only people on our floor. I asked for a room change but the front desk people basically told me to drop dead. Their attitude could best be described by the expression "too bad so sad"! I think the fact that they had so many other complaints that they just dont really care and are immune to the complaints. Its a job to them and they are just there to collect their pay.
reviews.title: Nightmares

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip was all inclusive, food and drink. The food was absolutely aweful My wife and I got sick immediately and basically suffered like that all week. The Hotel talks about 5 different restraunts but they all basically serve similar food. The food was so bad that by the end, we were just eating to make it through the week. The drinks were aweful. They make a big deal about alcholic beverages but they we so bad tasting, we gave up on that early on.
reviews.title: Sliding downhill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel sits in front of the ocean but you cannot swim in the water. There are some chairs by the pool but none were ever available. The other guests had the system of getting the pool towels the night before and then saving all the chairs for their friends and family. Many of these chairs were empty all day but the hotel made no effort whatsoever to be fair to all the other guests and just looked the other way even though they had signs posted everywhere that saving chairs was not permited. I could go on about what a horrible experience this was but i hope what little I said may help people avoid this hotel and tell everyone they know the same.
reviews.title: hated to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married at Dreams in 2005 and had a fantastic experience there--but we were disappointed with our latest trip back. It's too bad because it is a beautiful property, great beach, and idyllic setting for a romantic trip away. This time, we had to move rooms twice (first one was on the end of the new building away from the beach and with two double beds, the second was over a restaurant and the balcony was next to a generator). Anyway, the food this time around was the biggest disappointment. We are not big on all inclusive normally but the food at our wedding two years ago was amazing. This time, we could barely find edible meals. We're not sure if the management changed over, but we think the entire experience is not what it once was. In any case, we won't be going back. It's too bad.
reviews.title: Ok, not a bad time, but won't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won a four night stay here at a drawing att the New York Times travel show. We booked our other five nights thru skyauction. Our flight from Newark was delayed aver 31/2 hours so we missed our connection and did not get to the hotel until 10:15PM. We were greeted at the desk, and told we did not need to show our docs. Check in lasted about three minutes. We were told that the restaurants were still open or that room service was available 24 hours, no charge all inluded.
reviews.title: Dreams...more like a Nightmare-Huge Disappoinment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Jr. Suite looked gorgeous; lots of space with living room and dining table and walk in closet. After walking for five minutes my feet were brown with other stuff so had the floor cleaned which merely reduced the dirt and wore shoes around the room the rest of the stay.
reviews.title: Mix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The main pool with it's swim up bar is a playground for every age. The drinkware is the same for both adult and children beverages so I can see how youngsters can easily divulge a curiosity.
reviews.title: The Beautiful Dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second pool w/ swim up bar is quiet. I like it's two in-water eating areas, and the wading pool with lounge chairs inside it.
reviews.title: This vacation was a Dreams-come-true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pounding surf makes for a roped off beach where vendors sell silver and gorgeous scarves/sarongs, dresses, and tops. My favorite afternoon was lounging under the hut watching the water, eating authentic Mexican with Coronas.
reviews.title: Place is nice, but lots of problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I go back? Nah. Average resort.
reviews.title: Dreamy Dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Full disclosure, we bought a one bedroom timeshare second hand at this resort...sight unseen and based our purchase on the reviews here at Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed and doing High Fives when we arrived and continue to love every vacation here. We rent a car and do not use the all inclusive (timeshare owners and those who rent from them have this option). If we did not rent a car we would highly recommend the all inclusive. We like the location as it is half way between San Jose' and Cabo. We like the character of San Jose' and typically spend more time their...especially Baja Brewery and the artists shops. Todos Santos is worth the drive as well, they should be finished with the 4 lane highway by now...it can be a white knuckle drive otherwise.
reviews.title: Great Family Base in Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We typically load up on supplies at Sam's Club and the nearby supermarket for just breakfast and lunch supplies, then we make it a point to discover new restaurants. Our favorites so far are Mi Casa, The Office and Baja Brewery plus lots of little places were the locals go.
reviews.title: Oct trip to Cabo with Family and Friends for a few Special Events

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is always some fun activity going on at the resort and it is a great place for families with teenagers, the kids can go off and have their independence you know that they are safe within the resort. I enjoyed the tennis and yoga lessons. As a horse person, I was impressed with the horseback riding right on the beach...yes they are professional tail followers, but the horses are in good shape and there are some decent trails not far away.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The SPA was very quiet and would be great for a wedding group.
reviews.title: Not so dreamy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: We also loved the Catus ATV outting and the Whale Watching is the best that we have experienced. All in all, it hard not to have fun in Cabo.
reviews.title: Dreams is a dream.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My experience started off on the wrong foot when booking my stay. It took the concierge three-(3) days to reply to my e-mail so I copied the corporate office on my follow up e-mail and that got their attention. That was the only “hiccup”.
reviews.title: The Preferred Club Level is the only way to go...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Now…if you’re planning on booking a stay DEFINATLEY book yourself on the “Preferred Club Level” and I’d say in a Jr. Suite or better room. These rooms have great balconies to sit in the mornings/evenings and have the best views. I push the club level because they have their own bar/club which serves all the “top shelf” alcohols and their breakfast goodies, lunch snacks etc are far better than what’s available downstairs. But on the other hand they have more selection downstairs.
reviews.title: Two more weeks please!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool area is fantastic! Great service for everything….except my drinks because they don’t carry the premium grade alcohols downstairs…so I had to go upstairs to get taken care of. No biggie…gave me an excuse to get up and walk around.
reviews.title: Wedding Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was great! Slept like a baby. It’s very clean and well furnished. I was given turndown service every night. Bathroom products were very nice as well. Plush bath towels as well…none of those worn out towels that one comes across from time to time.
reviews.title: Overall great time ~ could improve in some areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: I’d do it again…I’m just not sure about the all you can eat/drink concept…kind of like an all you can eat buffet. I ALWAYS try to get my monies worth and I DID on this trip.
reviews.title: Don't go for the food
Top Notch Resort!
reviews.text: I just returned from a 9 Night stay at Dreams. We got married there and had 34 of our close friends and family join us. I have no regrets. This place was everything I was hoping it would be and our guests had the the time of their lives!

reviews.title: Fantastic Aniversary Trip 11-4 through 11-10 (Long)
reviews.text: The only reason why I did not rate this hotel Excellent is because not every meal I had was up to my standards, but then again this is not the Ritz Carlton...but it's the closest thing to it in the "All-Inclusive World"! However, after being there for a long stay we had time to try many different restaurants at the hotel and try several dishes. Most of the food was absolutely delicious. Here are some tips on what to try-

reviews.title: Pros and Cons
reviews.text: Oceana Restuarant:

reviews.title: One of our favorite places...
reviews.text: For Dinner-Very very good Clam Chowder Soup, Scallop appetizer, Salmon, and Jack Daniels Shrimp

reviews.title: Amazing location for group travel....
reviews.text: For Lunch-Mushroom Soup, Tuna Salad Sandwich, Shrimp Stuffed alvacado and Chicken Fajitas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never been to Cabo San Lucas before, I was nervous about finding the best resort that would be an ideal location for our wedding, with both proximity to Downtown Cabo and beauty of surroundings and good service for our 53 guests. We decided on an all-inclusive resort called Dreams, Cabo San Lucas, wedding date September 29, 2012. When we got to the resort we were greeted by concierge, the general manager and our wedding coordinator, Mariana Martinez. We were very, very pleased with the surroundings and the rooms --- thanks to our travel agent Rainbow Travel in El Cajon, California who helped us get an upgrade to the Honeymoon suite that was double the size of the regular rooms. The view from every room at the resort was picturesque with an ocean view. All of our guests expressed the same response we had upon arrival.
reviews.title: Our wedding at Dreams, Los Cabos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort also offered Kids Explorer Club, with hours from 9am to 10pm. I was a bit skeptical at first but my husband reassured me that the services were very professional and he felt our son was safe. Well, come to find out our son had a blast and made several new friends. Upon check-in, the staff provided us with a cell phone so that at any given point they could call us on the resort if our son needed us or in case of emergency. They were SO GREAT to the kids. They played in the kids hut, did activities like finger painting, face painting, activities out on the beach and meals on the resort (they chose closed restaurants so other people would not be around and the kids were in safe surroundings.) We were 10000% impressed with how they ran the service. We spoke to other parents whose children were in the kids club and they felt the same way. We can definitely see some parents choosing a particular resort because of the kids club.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Service at the resort was impeccable! There was only one small point when the rain broke out on did restaurant management have difficulty determining where they would relocate their restaurants. (All but one of the restaurants were outside so they moved food to a ballroom.) Well, on one night we had about 20 people and they had a very difficult time accommodating us. It took about an hour before we were finally seated. However, knowing the resort does not take reservations and we were a very large group, I complete understood but our very hungry guests not so much. As we said though, the resort does not take reservations but Mariana Martinez, our wedding coordinator, made several reservations to accommodate our large groups.
reviews.title: Recent stay - October 5-8, 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We HIGHLY suggest anyone wanting to get married in Cabo San Lucas get married at Dreams!!! Mariana was very hands-on and responsive and the resort was beautiful. Overall the week was glorious and there is no doubt we would recommend Dreams to anyone, getting married or just wanting to vacation.
reviews.title: Fantastic time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a wonderful, relaxing vacation. Especially liked not having to wear an armband. Staff was wonderful. Elsa at the pool was very friendly and offered drink suggestions. Loved the infinity pool & watching the ocean. The ocean was kind of noisy at night, strong tides. We enjoyed walking the beach everyday, even if we couldn't get in the ocen. The room was spacious & clean. The food was very good. We felt very safe at the resort at all times. Watching the horses on the beach who were awaiting riders broke my heart. It was way too hot for them. Otherwise, would go back in a heartbeat, thinking of booking again in the spring to do some whale watching.
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a lovely week at Dreams Resort!
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The property is lovely - although the beaches in that part of the country are not swimmable, I actually enjoyed looking at the clean empty beach with the surf crashing.
reviews.title: Great family destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a family resort, and my husband and I went as a vacation WITHOUT kids. This worked out fine, as there is a pool that is just for adults, and several of the restaurants offer adults-only dining for dinner and lunch. If you take your kids, be prepared for them to be very busy, and pay little or no attention to you. :) There are activities all day, AND there is also the Explorer's Club.
reviews.title: We Have been to Dreams several times and we just love it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: There are many free (included in "AI") activities and shows, and many off-site activities at reasonable prices. The food is good (great in some restaurants!), and varied -- we never had any trouble getting tables. Service is good. Bars are friendly, liquor is good quality . . . both pools have swim-up bars.
reviews.title: Nice Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our ONLY complaint was with Housekeeping. Our room usually only got serviced once a day -- and they say they service 3x a day? One day it was because we left the DND sign on the door. And it took me most of the week, but what I THINK was happening is that she would SEE us go in the room, and then -- because we were on the ground floor right by the adult pool -- we'd go out the porch door. So she thought we were still inside? Anyway, the room was beautiful when it was done, but it only got done once a day . . . this was only really an issue for us when we'd come in to clean up for dinner and not have dry towels.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second time to Dream Los Cabos and this time was even better than the first. Check in was seamless, the room was extremely clean (and I'm admittedly picky), the views are gorgeous, the service is unmatched (seriously), and the transportation provided is great. The only small things that could be improved are the quality of food and the cleanliness of the pools. The food is fine....but it's just that. It's completely what you would expect from an all-inclusive resort and the variety is impressive. The Japanese restaurant (Himatsu) is definitely the best place to eat dinner. Breakfast is generally pretty good (buffet). Lunch....so/so. Both Cabo San Lucas and San Jose del Cabo are about 15-20 minutes by van. It's worth going into these towns to check out the local flavor. The weather at the end of November is basically perfect. Mid-80's, sunny, breezy, and no humidity! You will want to reserve your pool seats VERY early (even though they say not to do this...do it or you won't get a seat). The sun sets fairly early this time of year, so make the most of the daylight. Personally, I would tip the housekeeper $3-$5 daily and that seemed to make quite a difference in how fast the room was cleaned. I also would tip $1 to the poolside bartender every time I ordered a drink. In addition to this, I would tip $2-$3 at dinner in the evenings. That's about it. I never spoke to the timeshare people....or rather they never spoke to me. They will hassle you at the airport (like the review written before me). You will WANT to believe them...they will say things like, "you are going the wrong way." Do NOT believe anyone after the security checkpoint until you can actually see blue sky. Apparently, the timeshare people are allowed in this area, but our personal resort transportation people are not. If you are traveling with Apple, Am Ex, Funjet, etc...your "person" is OUTSIDE....DO NOT STOP FOR ANYTHING. They will even get very close and into your personal space. Just ignore and keep walking...quickly. It's about 100 feet that you have to make it.
reviews.title: 2nd time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are going to Dreams and have read bad/rough reviews do not worry. This is not the Ritz Carlton, but it is extremely nice and clean. Everything is updated. The bathrooms have plenty of room and are nice. The beds are totally fine (no, they aren't the "heavenly" beds...but they are fine). The food is acceptable. The service is great. I personally stayed in room 5528 (on the far east side) and LOVED overlooking the quite pool and beach.
reviews.title: Dreams was a Dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoy your trip!
reviews.title: Very Belated Dreams Review - Horrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wpent a week at Dreams from 11/14-11/21. Check was a super quick and our room was ready. We were travelling with our two children, ages, 7 & 8, the check in person, Karina, made sure to include our kids in the whole check in process by having them sign the forms so they could sign for things at the hotel. This was a great touch and went over big with our kids. The room was 516, a suite, which had an incredible view. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was nicely updated with marble and granite. The food was good, not five star, but definately very good. Our son is a very picky eater, he loves Calamari, which is only served at Portofino;s, the italian restaurant, but they would get it brought over to El Patio everytime we asked. The buffets had a nice selection and kid friendly choices as well. The Seaside grill has a good lunch. The pool was beautiful, and the wait staff is excellent. We tipped all servers, and they were very appreciative. Overall the service was excellent, right down to the nightly turn down service with chocolates. A big plus at this resort is the 24 hour room service, which is quick, the food was always hot, and the ice cream was always cold. We asked how much to tip on room service and were advised 1 or 2 dollars each time. The entertainment crew is energetic and we highly recommend the snorkelling tour the hotel provides with them to a beach nearby for $20. The theme nights were great, we had a ball at pirate night, karaoke night, the tailgaters party, and don't miss the managers cocktail party with a raffle, we got a two for one dolphin swim through the tour desk. The beach is beautiful, but a bit rocky, and not swimmable, the entertainment crew has a beach walk and swim pretty much everyday that you can walk down to a nearby beach is you so desire. The service at this hotel, besides the beauty of the setting and grounds would definately bring us back again. The hotel also has a sea turtle program where guests can release newly hatched sea turtles into the sea, make sure to tell the concierge to notify you when they hatch. They also have bungee jumping everyday, which also went over big with our kids. Plan to get up early, people reserve pool chairs as early as sunrise! There was never a wait at any restaurant.Avoid the timeshare people at the airport, they try to make you think they are your transportation, just keep walking. One note, cabs to the two towns can get expensive, (25 plus each way), so try to use the hotel's shuttle, 12 each way, and keep in mind, the shuttle stops between 1 and 4 pm, which for us, was usually the time we went into town, LOL! Make sure to check out Mi Casa in Cabo, the food was outstanding! We would totally recommend Dreams, it was a great value, and a great resort.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Dreams last September for about a week following Labor Day Weekend. Our time here was a disaster from the start. When we arrived it took us 45 minutes to check in. Then, when we were finally taken to our room the lock on the door did not work. We reported to the front desk and waited for someone to come and fix it for about a half hour, no one came. I called again, we waited again, no one came. Then I went down to the front desk and waited there for a half hr for someone to come, all to fix something that took 2 seconds. After this rocky start, we decided to keep an open mind. The resort is very beautiful and is kept clean. However, the pool is not skimmed more than once a day and sunblock tended to congeal in one corner. Despite this minor thing, the grounds were very nice. The food, however, was disgusting. Only one restaurant was open each night, so if that wasn't what you liked, it was buffet for you. The buffet had so many flies and the food just wasn't good. We ate at the Italian restuarant which was ok, and the Japanese restaurant after which my husband was violently ill for 2 days. The fish restaurant was not open once in the week we were there. We ordered a lot of room service which was ok. The food they brought us by the pool was greasy and gross and looked different every time, even if you ordered the same thing. It was all a roll of the dice.
reviews.title: Dreams in Cabos not so bad

likes.disliked: — Food, No Swimming in the ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel has a great location and the romos away from the pool and facing the sea are just the best to get. Great Sushi, great seafood and the nicest restaurant is the italian one fully renovated. excellent service specially the reception staff which was totally attentive to our needs and care for our comfort.Overall very good experience though some opinions and tips here: beach bar needs deco renovation if you are one of those who observe details. they do plenty of wedding parties which is not nice if you are enjoying peacefully at the beach and they come and put 15 table and chairs and come and go all the time preparing for the event and then while you are at the beach afternoon time: there´s their event" so thats not pleasent at all. like 11pm they turn lights off and clse bars and all at the entire hotel, another downside and a surprise for us! great things? they have room service free of charge" nice to know. There´s like a coffee shop sturbacks style at front for the afternoons very nice drinks and pastries, there´s bathrobes and shoes for your use and each night they will come to make the bed a leave a chocolate, flower, Little picture...those are lovely details....still i would say is more appropiate for families"..if you are a couple there just the right one for you from the same owners couple hundred meters away...well then, enjoy!
reviews.title: Great for families"
First all-inclusive experience
reviews.text: We were looking for a relaxed, no-fuss tanning vacation and settled upon the Dreams. Neither I nor my husband had ever been to an all inclusive so we went in with no expectations. The property was large and comfortable and there were a number of restaurants and bars aplenty. We found ourselves going to the buffets a lot, as we were after light fare like salsa and fresh fish ceviche, which were always available there. Morning breakfast favourites consisted of mimosas and baguettes with fresh homemade pineapple jam so I was a happy camper, though I will say I didn't go there for gastronomy. The rooms were comfy and spacious and staff were very friendly and accommodating, my favourites being bartenders carlos and German. I would give this property five stars but had to dock one because it's so far from downtown. It costs $25 usd one way by cab!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had stayed in this lovely hotel for my Birthday. The things I like about this hotel is that when we first came in to our room it smells good, The bed was okay, and workers there are nice. Cons I found in this hotel was that the food wasn't great, and it is about 20mins away from the town. Overalls this place is very nice to have some relaxation.
reviews.title: Birthday getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at Dreams late on a Tuesday. Not greeted by anything special which was fine. Went to check in and someone took our luggage. After check in was told to get our "resort coupons" from another person who then tried to get us to agree to a time share presentation. We had been on a plane all day and had our 2 year old with us. We just wanted to get to our room and relax. When we said no for the 10th time we were finally allowed to go to our room. Our luggage never showed up. We then received a call describing our luggage and asked if it was ours. Finally an hour later our luggage came. Our "ocean front" room was blocked with palm trees. We could hear the ocean which was nice but all we saw were tree shrubs and we were on the 5th floor. We ventured out to get a drink and eat and this was hard. The only bar open was the one in the lobby which had a long line. So we went to find food which the restaurants were all closed except 2 of them. One the guy told us it would be an hour wait and the other was a buffet that had been out all night. So we waited an hour and then waited another hour for our food. After our first night things did get better. Over all the food is good for an all inclusive. The bottled water was a bit hard to get. They could not grasp the fact that we drank a lot of water and were rude every time we tried to get more. The real kicker was when they called my room the day before we were leaving and said they were charging me a $90 fee to clean the mattress. My son had spilt water on it the first night we were there(maybe that is why they didn't want to give us water anymore). Anyways I had stripped the bed and told the cleaning lady and everything seemed fine until the day before we left when they tried to tell me I owe $90 for a special cleaning that they had to do to the mattress. I was trying to tell them there must have been a misunderstanding but they said the charge is already there and they can't take it off. I questioned when they did this special cleaning because we were never gone from our room very long, they did not have an answer. So we paid $400/night plus $60 to use the internet plus $200 in tips and they had the nerve to come up with a bogus charge like this!!!! Besides the first night, the difficulty getting bottled water, the NO view of the ocean, and the bogus charge for a mattress cleaning it was a nice resort. Oh and the resort coupons are a joke. You can use $40 toward a massage which is $195 or use it for a bottle of wine and that is it.
reviews.title: poor management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dreams resort and spa is what I use as the bar for all other resorts. This place is the best and nicest resort there is hands down. Great places to eat, great pools and there is always something each night, from poker games, to movies for the kids. I have since gone back and when I go to Cabo will always plan to stay there. The only problem is you cant enter the water there as the surf is too rough. That is Cabo, and not the resort's fault.
reviews.title: Top of the line all the way!
